pain.t

Class MyCanvas

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • pain.t.MyCanvas
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class MyCanvas
extends javafx.scene.layout.Pane
    A canvas for displaying images and drawing on. It allows for shapes and Text to be drawn on it. The shapes can be seen changing while dragging the mouse. Colors can also be detected off of it.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  MyCanvas.Mode
      Allows for shapes to be drawn, erased, portions of the canvas to be selected, or colors to be grabbed from the eye dropper tool.
      static class  MyCanvas.Pen
      Allows for these shape types to be drawn

    • Constructor Detail

      • MyCanvas

        public MyCanvas()
        Creates a new custom canvas with the default width and height.

      • MyCanvas

        public MyCanvas(double w,
                double h)
        Creates a new canvas with the specified width or height
        Parameters:
        w - canvas width
        h - canvas height

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Erases everything on canvas and sets the canvas to default values. Also clears the stack for undo and redo.

      • reset

        public void reset(double w,
                  double h)
        Erases everything on canvas. The canvas will be created with new width and height values. Also clears the stack for undo and redo.
        Parameters:
        w - canvas' new width.
        h - canvas' new height.

      • reset

        public void reset(double w,
                  double h,
                  javafx.scene.paint.Paint background)
        Erases everything on canvas. The canvas will be created with new width and height values. A new background will be painted. This is mostly used for opening images. Also clears the stack for undo and redo.
        Parameters:
        w - canvas' new width.
        h - canvas' new height.
        background - the paint to use as a background to the new canvas.

      • setLineColor

        public void setLineColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Sets a new line color.
        Parameters:
        color - new line color.

      • getLineColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getLineColor()
        Gets the line color that is currently in use.
        Returns:
        Color the currently selected color.

      • SetFillColor

        public void SetFillColor(javafx.scene.paint.Color fillColor)
        Sets a new fill color.
        Parameters:
        fillColor - new fill color.

      • getFillColor

        public javafx.scene.paint.Color getFillColor()
        Gets the fill color that is currently in use.
        Returns:
        Color the currently selected fill color.

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(double width)
        Sets a new line width size for the line of shapes.
        Parameters:
        width - new line width.

      • getLineWidth

        public double getLineWidth()
        Gets the line width size currently being used by shapes.
        Returns:
        double the current line width.

      • setFontSize

        public void setFontSize(double fontSize)
        Sets a new font line size for text.
        Parameters:
        fontSize - the new text size.

      • getFontSize

        public double getFontSize()
        Gets the font line size that is currently in use for the text tool.
        Returns:
        double the font size

      • setPen

        public void setPen(MyCanvas.Pen shape)
        Sets the pen to use for future drawing. The pen sets which type of shape to draw (hand drawing, line, rectangle, square, circle, ellipse, text).
        Parameters:
        shape - MyCanvas.Pen corresponding to the desired shape or object to draw.

      • getPen

        public MyCanvas.Pen getPen()
        Gets the Pen / Shape Type that is currently in use.
        Returns:
        MyCanvas.Pen the currently used Pen / Shape Type.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(MyCanvas.Mode m)
        Sets the mode that allows the user to interact with the canvas. Modes: Draw, Erase, Select, EyeDropper. if user is using Select, it puts an empty zone behind where the image was selected
        Parameters:
        m - MyCanvas.Mode the mode selected by the user.

      • getMode

        public MyCanvas.Mode getMode()
        Gets the Mode that is currently in use. The mode can be either selecting parts of the image, eraser tool, dropper tool or regular drawing.
        Returns:
        MyCanvas.Mode the currently selected mode

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Undoes the last shape. Makes a copy of the last shape and puts it in a redo stack for an eventual redo action.

      • redo

        public void redo()
        Redoes the last 'undo' action. Pops shape off of the undo stack.

      • undoAvailable

        public boolean undoAvailable()
        Checks to see if there are any shapes on the canvas beside the background.
        Returns:
        true if undo is possible, false otherwise.

      • redoAvailable

        public boolean redoAvailable()
        Checks the undo stack to see if anything can be popped off / redone.
        Returns:
        true if redo is possible.

      • hasChanged

        public boolean hasChanged()
        Checks if there are any changes on the canvas. It resets to false when saving.
        Returns:
        True if changed. False if no changes.

      • openImageFromFile

        public void openImageFromFile(java.io.File file)
        Displays an image from a file on the canvas.
        Parameters:
        file - the file from which to get the image

      • saveImageAs

        public void saveImageAs(java.io.File file)
        Saves the canvas and anything on it in a file location
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which to save the image
